topic.title: NASA - Astronomy Photo of the Day

1_1G6QESmeipZsukJX5WvDxxwSioaGnEDRk3.body: @zerov, It's just basic HTML, you can find tutorials on the normal (centralised) web

2_1G6QESmeipZsukJX5WvDxxwSioaGnEDRk3.body: The NASA website has an API that allows anyone to download APoD. My server grabs this data every day, re-compiles it, create a simple website, signs it and then publishes it to ZeroNet - simple !

> [glightstar](#comment_3_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): Why not add to an existing website, or a data.json-File/ Database?That would assure, that everybody can view every picture one one Zite!Also, it would ensure enough peers all the time, as there would be no need to download a completely new Zite..:?

I'm still very new at ZeroNet, there is much I still don't understand yet !

2_1E8Hi8z7P6pCrKakZ3CuCLmTc69B1BLB9C.body: All I get is:  CONTENT.JSON DOWNLOAD FAILED
